bioghist.p: George Allen (1808-1876) was an educator, Episcopalian clergyman, and author. He was a professor of Greek language and literature at University of Pennsylvania. He was an avid collector of books, prints, and manuscripts on chess.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscript and printed material written or collected by Allen. Materials include: a bound handwritten manuscript titled "Lectures on the Athenian Drama"; notes pertaining to the study of French, Italian, Greek & Latin, including extracts from Thierschâ€™s Greek grammar; notes related to English, literature, and drama; talks and addresses; and materials related to the University of Pennsylvania, including correspondence, newspaper clippings, and offprints.
